subject: Investing
title: Rebalancing a Global Portfolio
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Rebalancing a Global Portfolio.

hook.text: After the US outperformed for years, one investor's 60/40 US/International portfolio drifted to 80/20.

buildup.text: Market movements push allocations away from targets. Rebalancing sells winners and buys laggards to restore balance.

discovery.text: This is systematically buying low and selling highâ€”the opposite of what emotions push you to do.

twist.text: Over-rebalancing adds transaction costs and taxes. Once or twice a year, or when bands drift 5%+, is enough.

climax.text: Use new contributions to rebalance when possibleâ€”directing fresh money to the underweight region avoids selling.

punchline.text: Rebalancing is disciplined contrarianism. It feels wrong every timeâ€”and works over time.

quiz.question: What does rebalancing a global portfolio effectively do?
options: Systematically buys low and sells high across regions
